technology: There were no technical difficulties experienced by the participant.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some mild concern about the pandemic still being present, but overall doesn't exhibit strong negative affect.
past_neg_affect: The participant recalls uncertainty and fear during the pandemic, and missing out on graduation, indicating a moderate level of negative affect related to past experiences.
communal_orientation: The participant actively engages in the conversation, shares personal experiences, and acknowledges the other person's feelings, showing a moderate level of communal orientation.
engagement: The participant is very engaged in the conversation, sharing their experiences, asking questions, and responding thoughtfully to the other person's comments.
defensiveness: The participant doesn't display any strong defensiveness, but does express some struggle in seeing the line between the scientific community and politics.

questions.transcript: What was your experience like a vaccination?
Did you end up contracting Covid at all?
Do you have any particular reservations about getting a booster shots?
And boosters are going to be in the near future.
My last question is, if in the future you think you would try a yearly Covid booster shot, I guess, kind of like the flu vaccine.

similarity_statements.transcript: Yeah. So I remember, kinda like what you said when I first seen those news China, and then just the other countries besides the United States.

kinda like you said I did see a couple people that were already wearing mass, as a you know, primitive measure in their health and I just kind of remember the demographics that they were kind of targeting.

Yeah, I, for sure had the like. The initial dose of Pfizer the first and the second one for sure, felt the side effects as far as just like soreness in my arm, but not as much as just like exhaustion or fatigue in my body but I just felt really comforted when I got that shot, because not only was I protecting myself, but I was really protecting the people around me, especially like you, said.
Yeah, for sure. I know. Or you said you lost your sense of taste as well, and I remember being such a weird feeling eating food, and just like, truly not taste anything.

vaccine_importance: The participant states that they will 100% promote and support vaccinations on any level, indicating that they believe vaccines are extremely important.
booster_importance: The participant says they will consider a yearly COVID booster shot and are open to it, suggesting that they believe boosters are moderately important.
cognitive_complexity: The participant acknowledges the intertwining of science and politics, and expresses a struggle in seeing the difference between the two, demonstrating a moderate amount of cognitive complexity.
general_notes: The participant seems to have a positive view of vaccines, but is more hesitant about boosters. They are very engaged in the conversation and try to relate to the other person's experiences.
